name: Adrenal
description: The adrenal gland consists of an outer Cortex (steroid secreting) and an inner Medulla (catecholamine secreting), surrounded by a capsule.

features: Cortex Zona Glomerulosa: Clusters/Arches of cells (Salt - Aldosterone)
Cortex Zona Fasciculata: Straight cords of vacuolated cells (Sugar - Cortisol)
Cortex Zona Reticularis: Anastomosing network of cells (Sex - Androgens)
Medulla: Chromaffin cells (large, granular, basophilic) and large veins
theory.examTips: Remember G-F-R (Glomerulosa, Fasciculata, Reticularis) -> Salt, Sugar, Sex. Medulla stains brown with Chromium salts (Chromaffin reaction). Spongiocytes = vacuolated cells of Zona Fasciculata (lipid droplets).

name: Parathyroid
description: The parathyroid glands are four small glands located on the posterior thyroid. They contain densely packed Chief cells and Oxyphil cells.

features: Chief Cells: Small, polygonal, central nucleus, pale cytoplasm (most abundant)
Oxyphil Cells: Larger, eosinophilic (pink) cytoplasm, small dark nucleus
location: Posterior surface of thyroid gland lobes
theory.examTips: Chief cells secrete PTH. Oxyphil cells are packed with mitochondria (hence eosinophilic) and function is unclear. Mistake for lymph node? No follicles/germinal centers here. Mistake for Thyroid? No colloid follicles here.

name: Thyroid
description: The thyroid gland consists of follicles filled with colloid (thyroglobulin), lined by follicular cells. Parafollicular (C) cells are found between follicles.

features: Thyroid Follicles: Spherical units filled with eosinophilic Colloid
Follicular Cells: Simple cuboidal epithelium (height varies with activity)
Parafollicular (C) Cells: Pale staining, in clusters between follicles
Colloid shows marginal scalloping when active
function: Calcium regulation - lowers blood Ca2+ (Calcitonin from C cells)
theory.examTips: Only endocrine gland that stores hormones EXTRACELLULARLY (in colloid). Active gland = Tall cells + Scalloped colloid. Inactive gland = Flat cells + Distended colloid. C cells secrete Calcitonin.
